metadata.name: Playa De Los Muertos
metadata.description:
Playa De Los Muertos - One of the most famous beaches at Cabo de Gata-Níjar, Andalusia, Spain. 

Short story about this photo - it was taken back in summer 2020 when the whole world was on halt. Since it was hard to travel by plane, i decided to go on a road trip to Spain and discover the marvellous region of Andalusia known for its unique desert landscapes, strong culture and sunny beaches with crystal-clear waters on the Mediterranean Sea surrounded by rocky cliffs . 

This place gets its name, which means "Beach of the Dead" from the fact that it was once used as a cemetery by the ancient Romans. Despite its name, Playa de los Muertos is a lively and beautiful place to visit.
